alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 8:49AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong showers will impact portions of Crawford, western Washington, eastern Sequoyah and southern Adair Counties through 930 AM CST... At 848 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong showers along a line extending from 4 miles north of Bunch to 2 miles southeast of Gans. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Stilwell... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Farmington... Alma... Prairie Grove... Muldrow... Roland... Lincoln... Gans... Chester... Moffett... Rudy... Adair State Park... Brushy... Blackburn... Maryetta... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 310 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
